description: Découvrez les meilleurs hôtels à Shanghai, China. Trouvez des offres exclusives et des hébergements de luxe.

hotels.title: China's Highest Skyscraper: Shanghai Luxury with Daily Breakfast, Nightly Cocktails & Fine Dining
hotels.description: Reach new levels of luxury at this sky-high spectacular, soaring above the clouds atop China’s tallest skyscraper. At J Hotel Shanghai Tower, every room offers the kind of views usually reserved for observation decks, paired with lavish finishes that redefine the high life. This isn’t just a stay - it’s a statement. On the 84th floor, a photo-worthy pool opens onto an expansive viewing deck, where guests can drift from the water to the clouds. This landmark stay also offers seven fine dining restaurants and bars, covering everything from Japanese and Cantonese to Mediterranean and even a patisserie. Don't miss Heavenly Jin, one of the world's highest restaurants, sitting 556 metres above ground. A realm of luxury like this calls for indulgent rituals at the onsite spa, while the state-of-the-art fitness centre keeps your routine on track. Positioned near the grand waterfront of The Bund, the hotel puts you in Shanghai’s beating heart - simply ask your butler to arrange your city adventures.

hotels.title: Hyatt Shanghai Riverside Retreat With Four Restaurants & Indoor Pool
hotels.description: Experience the epitome of Shanghai luxury with a stay at this five-star retreat, majestically positioned on the banks of the Huangpu River. Hyatt on the Bund Hotel offers breathtaking views of both the historic Bund and the futuristic Pudong skyline. Dine at one of the innovative onsite restaurants and bars, including authentic Chinese cuisine at Xindalu - China Kitchen and an international buffet at Aroma. The hotel’s Yuan Spa offers a tranquil sanctuary for relaxation and rejuvenation, with a range of treatments, plunge pools, saunas and more. Venture out to explore the vibrant city, with the famous Yu Garden and bustling Nanjing Road shopping district a short drive away or visit the Bund Sightseeing Tunnel and Pudong's business district.

hotels.title: Opulent Shanghai Escape with Indoor Pool, Four Restaurants & Bars
hotels.description: Soak up the buzz of the city while kicking back in high-rise comfort at this lavish urban sanctuary. With sleek rooms, skyline views and direct access to one of Shanghai’s top shopping malls, it’s got the best of both worlds. Whether you’re here for business or fun, everything Shanghai has to offer is at your fingertips. Smack in the heart of the Putuo District, you’re steps from Jinshajiang Road metro station and moments from the city’s must-sees. Start your day with a dip in the indoor pool, or wind down at night with cocktails at Sky Bar overlooking the city lights. From rooftop moments to retail therapy, this is Shanghai living done right.

hotels.title: Tranquil Chongming Island Escape with Three Restaurants & Indoor Pool
hotels.description: Retreat to the peaceful charm of Chongming Island, where this nature-inspired escape offers modern comfort amid wetlands, forests and slow-paced village life. Designed to echo traditional Jiangnan architecture, the resort is a serene haven surrounded by blooming gardens and fresh country air, an hour from Shanghai. Take a refreshing dip in the indoor pool, lounge on the terrace or maintain your wellness routine at the onsite fitness centre. Savour farm-to-table cuisine at Market Café, indulge in refined Shanghai and Chongming flavours with fresh and authentic Chongming local food at Pin Yue and enjoy a spacious Lobby Lounge area for relaxing. Wander through Dongping National Forest Park, kayak the wetlands, or cycle tree-lined country roads - this is the perfect base to explore Chongming.

hotels.title: Shanghai Urban Oasis with Four Onsite Restaurants & Bars, Infinity Pool & Spa
hotels.description: Transition from Shanghai’s bustling streets to the quiet calm of this harmonious haven resort, soaking up the city's rich history while embracing restorative reflection. Explore the vibrant Jing’an district, uncover the secrets of the Zhangyuan heritage site and connect to nature at the nearby Jing’an Park. Unwind with soothing treatments at Spa Alila, a welcome respite with skilled therapists and innovative healing therapies, or dip in the expansive 19-metre infinity pool. When hunger strikes, dine at one of four onsite restaurants and bars -- participate in an afternoon tea ceremony at Chayan @ 5TH, sip on cocktails at the top-floor Secret Roof, or enjoy expertly grilled Japanese robatayaki at Garden Pavilion.

hotels.title: Sophisticated Shanghai Lakefront City Break with Onsite Dining & Indoor Pool
hotels.description: Admire the timeless beauty of Songjiang, the cultural cradle of Shanghai, with a serene stay at this Hyatt sanctuary overlooking Wulong Lake. Songjiang’s 6,000-year history breathes through the nearby ancient pagodas, traditional gardens and cultural parks, while the hotel pays tribute to the region’s legacy with design elements inspired by its storied textile traditions. Wake up to tranquil views, swim in the sparkling indoor pool and try out authentic Jiangsu and Zhejiang cuisine, including the signature Peking duck at the hotel's Xiang Yue restaurant. Explore the city's cultural gems and return to your hotel for well-crafted cocktails, all while you soak up Shanghai's beauty.

hotels.title: Sky-High Shanghai Five-Star Opulence near Oriental Pearl Tower with Seven Restaurants & Indoor Pool
hotels.description: Soar above Shanghai’s glittering skyline in one of the world’s highest hotels with a stay in the iconic Jin Mao Tower, offering panoramic views of the Huangpu River and The Bund. Housed between the 58th and 85th floors of this architecturally awe-inspiring building, this Grand Hyatt sanctuary boasts elegant rooms featuring allusions to the city's Art Deco heritage. Step outside to explore top attractions including the Oriental Pearl Tower and Nanjing Road, all just moments away, or hop on the nearby Lujiazui Metro for seamless city access. Back at the hotel, embark on a culinary journey across celebrated restaurants: from traditional Cantonese to gourmet Japanese fare, there is much to feast on. Later, head to Cloud 9, perched on the 87th floor, for well-crafted cocktails paired with unbeatable views.
